info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:28AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
East Fork White River.
Muscatatuck River near Vernon.
.Significant and some major flooding is already occurring or expected to develop along the East Fork White River and its immediate tributaries in Shelby and Bartholomew Counties due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall that have added up to 6 to 8 inches in the past week and additional rainfall is expected into Sunday morning. The crest on the East Fork should be in the Columbus Sunday morning and Seymour around Sunday night and points downstream thereafter.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...East Fork White River at Seymour.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Major flooding in progress. River is at highest level since June 2008. Numerous evacuations. Most local roads are extensively flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Saturday was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 230 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Jackson, IN; Lawrence, IN; Washington, IN
